snippet: Officials said the aim in a new wave of attacks was not espionage but sabotage, and that the source seemed to be in the Middle East.
abstract: New wave of cyberattacks is striking American corporations, prompting warnings from federal officials who say attackers' aim is not espionage but sabotage; officials also say source seems to be in Middle East.

byline.original: By DAVID E. SANGER and NICOLE PERLROTH
byline.contributor: David E. Sanger reported from Washington, and Nicole Perlroth from San Francisco. Michael S. Schmidt contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Officials said the aim in a new wave of attacks was not espionage but sabotage, and that the source seemed to be in the Middle East.

headline.seo: Cyberattacks on Rise Against U.S. Corporations
headline.main: Cyberattacks Against U.S. Corporations Are on the Rise
headline.print_headline: Cyberattacks on the Rise Against U.S. Corporations
